Function Documentation

int* allocate_array ( const char *  argv[],
int  argc,
int *  num_elems 
)

This function allocates an array of a sufficient size to store the numbers passed in argv[].

Parameters:
argv const char pointer to argv array from command line
argc number of arguments on command line
Returns:
pointer to base of array of numbers
Note:
This does not check type of string on line. It is assumed to be int.

void fill_array ( const char *  argv[],
int *  new_array,
int *  num_elems 
)

This function fills the elements of an array with that of argv

Parameters:
argv const char pointer to argv array from command line
new_array pointer to first element in array to be filled
max_elems number of maximum elements that can be placed in array
argc number of arguments on command line

void print_array ( int *  array,
int  num_elements 
)

This function prints the elements of an array, one per line. This is modified from the example in Ciaraldi's Class 7 Example on slide 36

Parameters:
array pointer to first element in array (base)
num_elements number of elements actually filled in the array
Note:
the highest index should be num_elements-1

void sort_array ( int *  array,
int  num_elements 
)

This function sorts the elements of an array of ints from greatest to least This is modified from the example in Ciaraldi's Class 7 Example on slide 28

Parameters:
array pointer to first element in array (base)
num_elements number of elements actually filled in the array
Note:
uses bubble sort algorithm developed by tcpong @ cs.ust.hk
